page.title: 06Housing in Elsworth
page.content:
Elsworth has 218 houses of which two are Tudor and a number are thatched cottages and houses from intervening periods. There has been some modern development but this is restricted as most of the land cannot be changed from agricultural to residential.
Elsworth is a very desirable area and house prices are high. There is little council housing and young families find that they cannot afford the houses. This is leading to a state where only older people move to the village with consequent social implications.
